How To raise a Teenager
Monster Rancher Metropolis: The Cafe: Archived Topics From Prior Years: Year 2002 Topics ( Year Of The Password): How To raise a Teenager
By Anonymous on Monday, December 30, 2002 - 08:39 am:

I got the idea from the "How To Raise a Collage Student Using MR2 methodology" topic from the year 2000 archived topics,in case you were wondering. This is somewhat differant because I've added/taken away some factors. So without further ado...

Main types of teens:
Understanding:Tends to have the "patient" characteristic,sees reasoning behind most actions
Laid-Back(AKA Lazy):Teen doesn't like to work much unless paired with a "Hardworker" sub-type,in wihc case the teen will perform better overall. Tends to have the "laid-back" attribute(duh)
Hardworker:Teen tends to work hard, but will sometimes refuse to rest in order to get work done. Worls best with "laid-back" subtype
Self-absorbed:Teen only cares about itself and its appearance, tends to have the "mall zombie" attribute(loves to buy things without telling you)
Doormat:Teen only cares about others and making them happy. Tends to have the "servant" attribute.(Teen goes out of its way to do what you ask)

Raising Factors
There are 2 main factors to consider when raising your teen:Happiness(how happy your teen is with its life) and Trust(how much your teen trusts you). At first Happiness will be so-so and Trust will be 0. A happy teen will perform better and gains Trust faster, and a teen that trusts you will be more willing to do what you say. Here's how to calculate Trust and Happiness:

Happiness
There are 4 factors that effect Happiness:Content,Happiness(seperate from the main Happiness rating),Boredom,and Unhappiness,with each value able to go up to 100. To work out your teen's main Happiness rating, the following formula is used:
(Happiness-Unhappiness+Content)/Boredom
As you can see,it is very hard for a Bored/Unhappy teen to be happy.

Trust
There are 3 main factors in Trust:How much you take your teen's likes and dislikes into consideration,how happy it is, and how often you let your teen get hurt/sick(they all go up to 100). Trust increase each week if you're doing everything right and decreases if you're on the wrong track. Trust is calculated as follows:
Happiness+# of liked actions taken on teen(feeding/giving an item that is liked, doing it's favorite drills,etc.)-(Frequencty of injuries/sickness+# of disliked actions taken on teen)
If the number is positve, you will gaint Trust. If negitive, you will lose Trust.

My Stats:
Lif=300(I'm average in endurance)
Pow=750(I'm MUCH stronger than I look)
Int=999(if my brain size was proportional to my intelligance, it'd weigh about 300 pounds!)
Ski=600(I'm very accurate at everything)
Spd=650(It goes down temporarily if I run for too long)
Def=50(except for my bones. They have a Def. of 999)

Breed:Understanding/Laid-back/Hardworker

Form:Normal(leaning towards Slim)

Life Stage:2

Age:13 Years 2 Months

Nature:Best

Style:Easy

Likes:Milk,Chocolate,Video Games,Science,Computers,Monster Rancher,Pokemon

Dislikes:Most vegitables and fruits,soda pop,hamburgers,writing(most of the time),barbies,clothes shopping,makeup,perfume

Characteristics:

Diamond Bones:As a result of drinking 2 gallons of milk a week and comsuming many other dairy products, the bones cannot be broken and any hits to the bones to only 1 damage to Lif.

Bottomless pit: This characteristic, common among teenagers, allows an infininte amount of food to be fed each week.

Laid-back:Can gain no more than 3 stress a week under normal circumstances

Patient:Takes longer for teenager to dislike people

Computer Whiz:Excels at anything that involves computers and gets rid of 2 stress when using a computer.

Cheerful:Rarely gets unhappy, which cause the teenager's performance to improve.

Intelligent:Gains Int. quicker than normal and all Int-based attacks get powered up a little

Nearsighted:All attacks that are not in close range lose Accuracy

Items that can be used:

Glasses:Corrects Nearsightedness when worn, can be broken

Milk:-100 Stress,-100 Fatigue, +1 Def.,+1 Bone Hardness,+5 Happiness

Pokemon Red OR Pokemon Blue(both have same effect):-50 Stress,-25 Fatigue,+10 Happiness

Pokemon Yellow:-40 Stress,-30 Fatigue,+12 Happiness

Pokemon Gold:-80 Stress,-75 Fatigue,+25 Happiness

Pokemon Silver/Crystal(both have same effect):-70 Stress,-80 Fatigue,+25 Happiness

Pokemon Stadium 2:-100 Stress,-90 fatigue,+50 happiness

Monster Rancher 1/2(both have same effect):-90 Stress,-100 Fatigue,+49 Happiness

Monster Rancher 3:-99 Stress,-89 Fatigue,+55 Happiness

Book:+15 Int.(not that I need it),+5 Happiness

Nickelback:Silver Side Up:+25 Happiness,+5 Content,-5 stress

Light Drills(all increase Content by 10):

PS2 Time:
Stress/Fatigue(can be either)-20,Form+5,Ski increases slightly

N64 Time:
Stress-5,Form+3,Lif+1

Reading:
Fatigue-13,Int+15

Computer Time:
Happiness+10,Int+3,Ski+7

Hard Drills(all increase Boredom by 3 and Unhappiness by 1 unless otherwise stated):
Prime Time:
Stress+/-1(can be either),no Unhappiness increase.

Computer Class:
Boredom-8,Unhappiness-8,Happiness+8,Int.+3,Ski+6

Orchestra:
No Unhappines Increase,Boredom+10,Int.+3(look at how many of these drills increase Int!), chance of learning "Violin Distraction" and "Screechy Playing" attacks

Phy. Ed Class:
No Boredom Increase,Pow.+20,Spd.+5,Ski+3,Lif+1,Fatigue+40,chance of learning "Hockey Stick Whack"

Tutorial:
No Unhappiness increase,content +1,lif+1,form+2

Math Class:
Int+30,Ski+100(probablity helps calcukate how to strike with a good chance of hitting^_^),no Unhappiness increase,chance of learning "20-digit Pi recital"

Social Studies Class:
Boredom and Unhappiness increases doubled,Stress+7,Int+3,Lif+5

Lunch:
Form+1,no Unhappiness or Boredom Increases,Def+1

Science:
Unhappiness,Boredom,and Stress cut in half,Int+30,Ski+30(laws of Science help you hit^-^),chance of learning "Ultimate Science Trivia" attack

Language Arts:
Stress+50,Lif+45,excempt from "Laid-Back"attribute

Rotation:
*varies according to Rotation class*


Attacks:

11 Digit Pi Recital:
Annoys Opponent by repeatedly saying "Pi is 3.14159263472"
Wither:B Hit:A Damage:- Guts:11(one for each decimal digit)

Random Violin Playing:
Randomly plays notes on the violin,annoying the opponent
Wither:C Hit:B Damage:E Guts:20

Science Trivia:
Babbles hundreds of facts about science,causing opponent to go insane
Wither:S Hit:S Damage:D Guts:2

Kick:
Kicks opponent with great force
Hit:D(I'm a slow kicker) Damage:A Sharpness:C Guts:15

Tackle:
Tackles opponent at high speed
Hit:B Damage:S Sharpness:B Guts:34

Milk Chug:
Drinks Milk to recover Guts and Lif. fully
Hit:S Damage:- Recovery:Z(better than S) Guts:1

Primal Fury:
Goes beserk and randomly injures opponent
Hit:S Damage:Z Guts:99

Speed Punch:
Punches opponent quickly and with great force
Hit:Z Damage:A Guts:25

Zone Out:
Zones out for a period of time in which the opponent will not attack,but rather wave a hand in front of my face to get me to snap out of it(useful for having time to regain Guts or to wait out the rest of the battle if I am winning)
Hit:Z Damage:-
